definition: to feel a chill (as an emotional response)/to feel cold (as a clinical symptom)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: She was underdressed for the hiking trip and suffered hypothermia.
sentences.chinese: 她徒步旅行時穿得有些薄弱，因此以爲渾身發冷。

sentences.english: The most common symptoms were chills and facial flushing .
sentences.chinese: 最常見的症狀是發冷，顏面潮紅。

sentences.english: He sniffled from a cold in the head.
sentences.chinese: 他因頭部發冷而不停地喘粗氣。

sentences.english: Hot heads and cold hearts never solve anything .
sentences.chinese: 頭腦發熱和心腸發冷不能解決問題。

sentences.english: And then an idea flashed in my mind; it sent a shudder5 all over of me.
sentences.chinese: 隨即一個念頭閃入我腦中，讓我全身一陣發冷。

sentences.english: I felt a chill creep over me.
As I read, I felt cold chills running up and down my arms.
sentences.chinese: 讀着這本意見簿，我身上感到一陣陣地發冷。

sentences.english: He was underdressed for the hiking trip and suffered hypothermia.
sentences.chinese: 他徒步旅行時穿得有些單薄，因此感覺渾身發冷。

sentences.english: Accidentally leaving your planner at home causes you to break into a cold sweat.
sentences.chinese: 在家的時候突然中斷你的計劃，導致你渾身發冷汗。

definition: to feel oppressed/to be depressed/to feel dejected
to collapse (from dehydration or loss of blood)/heat exhaustion
sharp pain/cramp/griping pain/colic/angina, cf 心絞痛|心绞痛
to faint with blurred vision (idiom); dizzy and eyes dimmed
top-heavy/fig. unbalance in organization or political structure
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
